item.title: Warhammer 40K Space Marine 2: How to Prestige (& What It Does)
item.description:
Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 players can rejoice, as they can show their battle brothers how advanced they are in the art of war against Tyranids and Heretics by proving their veteran status thanks to the Prestige Mode featured within the gameâ€™s Operations mode. Now that Space Marine 2 players can Prestige all Classes, they might want to know how.

Hitting Prestige is great for restarting with an extra bonus, providing players with new opportunities to go at it again and earn their perks, along with the advantages of having an exclusive and permenant perk associated with prestige, so listed below is both how to prestige, and every Prestige Perk for every Class.

How to Prestige in Space Marine 2

In order to prestige in Space Marine 2 , players must have reached Level 25 on any character. Once they have hit Level 25, they can enter the Armoring Hall to select the Perk Customisation option on the right, where at the bottom of the page, there will be an Unlock Prestige Level section. At Level 25, players can prestige for 100 Requisition Points. If players are short on Requisition Points, a vendor in the Armoring Hall sells them for Armory Data.

Once players exchange 100 Requisition Points for Prestige , they will have to choose a perk for Prestige Perk Slot 1. There are 7 Prestige Perks per Class to choose from, and it's important to take the one that's right for you as there's no going back once it's been exchanged , and they will have to reach Level 25 again to get all of their perks back and to hit the next prestige rank for an additional permanent perk.

Initiating a Prestige Level will grant players an additional 10% XP boost with the Class they hit prestige with, and this stacks by 10% for every prestige on said Class.

item.title: Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remaster Reveal Seems Imminent
item.description:
Summary

  • Tags on Bethesda's website point to the rumored Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered being announced soon.
  • Virtuos is believed to be developing the remaster, with combat and UI improvements expected.
  • Screenshots of Oblivion Remastered have leaked online, along with a potential release date set around April 21.

An official announcement for the remaster of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion feels imminent, as fans discover data on Bethesda's website that hint at the project. It's been an exciting week for The Elder Scrolls fans, as footage of the Oblivion remaster began to emerge across social media. The project was long rumored to be in development, backed by Microsoft's court documents during the purchase of Activision Blizzard. It spoke of Bethesda's work on The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered , a modern remake of the open world classic from 2006.

However, very little was known about the project, and many fans were skeptical that the remake would ever materialize. When screenshots of Oblivion Remastered leaked online, it shocked The Elder Scrolls community and the gaming world at large. Players saw a glimpse of a modern Cyrodiil for the very first time, seemingly confirming that the project was real.

As more and more details began to emerge about the project, a fan named Such-Ad5976 managed to dig up information about The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered via Google Tag Manager. Namely, it showed a reference to "oblivion-remastered" among Bethesda's other titles, and curiously, the tag didn't exist on April 10, 2025. These references have since been removed, but all signs point that they were recently added by Bethesda in anticipation of Oblivion Remastered . While no concrete release date has been given just yet, industry insiders such as Jeff Grubb state that the remake of The Elder Scrolls 4 will launch on the week of April 21, 2025.

What To Expect in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered

While Bethesda Game Studios developed the original version of Oblivion , the remaster is supposedly being made by Virtuos. Rumors are that it will be shadow dropped by Bethesda for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S by the end of April 2025. According to previous leaks, the combat system in Oblivion Remastered will come with some major improvements, especially when it comes to dodging and archery. Furthermore, the user interface is rumored to have undergone an overhaul as well.

Oblivion Remastered is a unique opportunity for Bethesda. It has been nearly two decades since Oblivion launched, and Bethesda games have evolved dramatically since then. Given the mixed reception of Starfield at launch, Oblivion Remastered could give Bethesda valuable feedback on whether going back to its roots for The Elder Scrolls 6 will be worth it. Players should expect Oblivion Remastered to be announced soon, with the game likely set to come out on or shortly after April 21, 2025.

item.title: Nintendo Fans Still Have 1 Big Complaint About Mario Kart World
item.description:
Summary

  • Nintendo fans are upset about the $80 price of Mario Kart World, leading some to demand a lower price online.
  • Fans have made "DROP THE PRICE" trend on Twitter.
  • Angry fans also flooded the Mario Kart World Direct with demands for Nintendo to lower the price.

Nintendo fans are still upset about the Mario Kart World price, flooding the game's recent Nintendo Direct presentation with demands to lower it. Mario Kart World will be one of the launch titles for the upcoming Nintendo Switch 2, but it will be rather expensive. Anyone interested in getting Mario Kart World at launch can expect to shell out $79.99, which is the price of both the physical and digital versions of the game.

There was some confusion about the Mario Kart World price in the wake of the Switch 2 Direct, with some reports indicating that the physical version of the game will cost $90. That thankfully doesn't seem to be the case, but $80 is still $10 more than the current industry standard of $70. Regardless, Nintendo fans are not happy about how much Mario Kart World costs, and they have let their voices be heard online.

Disgruntled Nintendo fans managed to make "DROP THE PRICE" trend on Twitter earlier, and they also flooded the chat during the recent Mario Kart World Direct with the same message. Nintendo believes that Mario Kart World 's content justifies its higher price tag, but it seems many fans remain unconvinced. Time will tell what kind of impact this controversy will have on the game's sales, but if Mario Kart 8 Deluxe 's startling longevity is any indication, Mario Kart World will likely have little trouble selling like hotcakes, even at the $80 price tag.

Nintendo Fans Still Aren't Happy About the Mario Kart World Price

Some gamers are upset about the Mario Kart World price not because it means that they will have to pay more for the game, necessarily, but because of the impact it could have on the industry at large. For example, if Mario Kart World is still a sales success despite its $80 price, it will be the greenlight for other game publishers to follow suit. Fans seem to be concerned about Grand Theft Auto 6 's price in particular, with many worried that Mario Kart World 's high price is opening the door for GTA 6 to cost $100.

We'll have to wait and see what happens, but in any event, it does not appear as though Nintendo has any plans to drop Mario Kart World 's price. On the bright side, Nintendo fans do have a chance to get Mario Kart World at a discount. Those that managed to snag the Nintendo Switch 2 Mario Kart World bundle will be saving themselves $30 total, though the bundle will be in limited supply and won't be available by fall 2025.

item.title: Neon Giant says Its Next Game â€˜Project Impactâ€™ Will Surprise People With its Ambition
item.description:
Despite having only released one game so far, 2021's ARPG The Ascent , developer Neon Giant is made up of several industry veterans who have worked on some huge games, including the likes of Wolfenstein , Far Cry 3 , and Gears of War . For this reason, it's no surprise that the Swedish studio's next game is looking to dwarf The Ascent in terms of its ambition. Now, Neon Giant has shared the first details about the game that has a working title of 'Project Impact'.

Game Rant spoke with Neon Giant's creative directors Tor Frick and Arcade Berg who were able to share some preliminary information about Project Impact. The studio's staff have plenty of experience in the FPS genre, and they are looking to put this experience to good use with this upcoming game, which they confirm will indeed be first-person.

First Details of Project Impact Revealed

With The Ascent being an isometric twin-stick shooter, some may assume that Neon Giant's next game would follow suit. However, the studio's core staff have instead reverted to what Frick described as their 'bread and butter', a first-person game. With years of combined experience in the genre, it seems to be a smart move that will allow Neon Giant to flex its creative muscles while utilizing the staff's key strengths. Frick said,

'' It's first person, with a similar futuristic Cyberpunk setting to what The Ascent had. We're actually going back to where we feel very confident as the team has lots of experience with first-person games. The ambition and the aim are that this game is going to be a reference game. It's going to be in every conversation when someone else wants to make a game like this.''

The World Itself Will Be a Big Focus in Project Impact

Those are strong words from Frick, underlining how high the team is setting the bar for Project Impact. Berg went even further by highlighting how important the world itself will be to the game. Player agency will be one of the key components of Project Impact, with the team pushing to make a highly interactive environment for players. Berg continued that, as more details start to come through about it, the project's ambition may surprise people in the best possible way. He explained,

''We have the confidence to experiment and have fun and really push technology as we move into first person. So I think people will be quite amazed at what they'll be playing once this is out and once we start showing more, it's a huge step forward for the studio. The Ascent was a rather ambitious project for the team. But this is a lot more ambitious. So we think people will be very surprised, in a good way, once we share more about it.''

A first-person game set in an immersive, futuristic world with a high degree of player agency is sure to intrigue fans. Other details can't be shared just yet, leaving much of the project shrouded in mystery for now. Hopefully, Neon Giant can share more information on Project Impact sooner rather than later.

Project Impact is currently in development.
